name: Spenser for Hire Online Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who wrote the books the show is based on?
questions.explanation:
Robert B. Parker

	Robert B. Parker was the creative force behind not only Spenser but Tom Selleck's Jesse Stone TV movies. 'Appaloosa' made it to the big screen as a late entry into the western genre.

questions.text: The original TV series starred which actor in the title role?
questions.explanation:
Robert Urich.

	Robert Urich was the seminal actor for Spenser in its serial run and its original TV movies. He stated that the role was his favorite portrayal. Joe Montegna did reprise the role in later made for TV movies that more closely followed book story lines and titles.

questions.text: Avery Brooks was also a tenured professor at Rutgers University when he portrayed which character?
questions.explanation:
Hawk.

	Avery made this character uniquely his own. His performance in the role is best summed up by his own description--"I never thought of myself as the sidekick... I've never been the side of anything. I just assumed that I was equal". Like Spenser his identity is mysteriously vague.

questions.text: The setting for this series is the author's own hometown of what city?
questions.explanation:
Boston.

	The original series was filmed mainly in Boston. The city was so closely linked to the character that Parker even penned a non fiction pseudo travel guide entitled 'Spenser's Boston'.

questions.text: Hawk's character in the show starts as an enforcer who works for King Powers a local mob boss played by which former Boston Celtic basketball player and actor?
questions.explanation:
Chuck Connors.

	Born Kevin (a name he hated) Connors, he played for the newly formed Boston Celtics as well as the MLB Dodgers, his favorite child hood team. He was also drafted by the Chicago Bears although he never wore that uniform. His nickname came from his baseball days as a kid yelling for his teammates to 'chuck' him the ball.

questions.text: Lt. Nick Webster came to the show replacing which character that had been played by Richard Jaeckel?
questions.explanation:
Lt. Martin Quirk

	The Quirk character left the show after he suffered an angina attack. Lt. Webster begins a new more adversarial relationship on his first day in charge by ordering Spenser out of the precinct.

questions.text: What is Spenser's first name on the show?
questions.explanation:
We don't know.

	The show follows the concept established in the book of never revealing his first name. Spenser is often quick to point out that it is "Spenser with a 'S', like the poet."  But he never claims Edmund.

questions.text: The love of Spenser's life is which character?
questions.explanation:
Susan Silverman.

	Susan is in the original season and disappears for the second season with Rita being introduced as the new woman. Susan reappears for the third season and Rita is gone with no explanation.

questions.text: Spenser reveals he used to be a cop and was also a pugilist in his younger days. What is a pugilist?
questions.explanation:
boxer.

	He indicates in the TV show that he ended that career after doing badly in a fight. The books claims he fought Jersey Joe Walcott when Joe was on his way down. Spenser is grateful as he says Walcott would have killed him on his way up.

questions.text: The series began in 1985 with a two hour pilot that bore the same title as which book?
questions.explanation:
Promised Land.

	This was the only episode titled after a Spenser novel. Curiously, a 1986 episode was titled 'Widow's Walk' which became a book title in 2002 with a completely different plot line.
